item.title: Royal Artillery under fire after denying access to looted Asante treasure
item.description:
â€˜Extraordinaryâ€™ golden lambâ€™s head pillaged in 1874 from what is now Ghana remains hidden in officersâ€™ mess The Royal Artillery is facing criticism after it emerged they are refusing public access to an â€œextraordinary objectâ€ looted by the British army in the 19th century from the Asante people in modern-day Ghana. The glistening golden ramâ€™s head would seemingly be worthy of any museum, but it remains hidden within the regimentâ€™s mess at Larkhill in Wiltshire. Continue reading...
